choices: The relationship between inputs and outputs

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the relatively stable nature of the SPS graph in Figure 2 imply about the system?
choices: The system is not experiencing any user traffic.
The system is exhibiting predictable behavior, even if complex.
Chaos Engineering experiments are not impacting the system.
The system is about to experience a major outage.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following is NOT one of the four principles of Chaos Engineering described in the article?
choices: Design hypotheses based on a system\'s steady-state behavior.
Recreate hypothetical failure scenarios in a controlled test environment.
Introduce real-world events or simulate their effects.

multiple_choice_question.text: Why does Netflix emphasize running Chaos Engineering experiments in production environments?
choices: It\'s impossible to fully replicate the complexity of a production system elsewhere.
Production environments are more stable and predictable.
It\'s cheaper to cause outages in production than in a test environment.
Netflix engineers enjoy disrupting live user experiences.
